timeline.bodyText: Seems the first iteration focuses on IPv4, which is totally fine. IPv6 will also be supported, right?
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: When you get a chance, please include the design doc in the PR as well. Thanks.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Can you update concurrency handling section? When multiple clients try to allocate IPs from the same subnet, it could potentially get the same IPs. how do you handle this situation?
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Let us plan to add more UTs as well.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: One general comment: We will need to verify the response as well. We could do it later.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText:
For IPv4AddrService, I would suggest to split into two layers, service layer and service impl layer.
Service Layer: Show the interface
Service Impl Layer: Show the implementation of the interface. This design allows different implementations later on.
One example of the above design is SubnetManager:
https://github.com/kevin-zhonghao/alcor/tree/feature/route_manager/services/subnet_manager/src/main/java/com/futurewei/alcor/subnet/service
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.message: Change the microservice name ip_manager to private_ip_manager
design doc for private ip manager

timeline.bodyText: Let us add a section on the design doc about the allocation algorithm :-)
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.message: add some test cases for private ip manager

timeline.bodyText: The key here is the subnet Id. How about multiple ip ranges per subnet?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: I think an ip range is actually a subnet , maybe i should called it rangeId instead of subnetId?
replies.author: chenpiaoping

replies.bodyText: Hmm, a subnet could have at least one Ipv4 range and one Ipv6 range.
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Use RangeId as the key sounds better. We could add an ID field in the IpAddrRange class.
replies.author: xieus

+package com.futurewei.alcor.privateipmanager.allocator;
+
+
+import com.futurewei.alcor.privateipmanager.exception.IpAddrNotEnoughException;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+public interface IpAddrAllocator {
+
+    String allocate() throws Exception;
+
+    List<String> allocateBulk(int num) throws IpAddrNotEnoughException, Exception;
+
+    void release(String ipAddr) throws Exception;
+
+    void releaseBulk(List<String> ipAddrList) throws Exception;
+
+    boolean valid(String ipv4Addr);

replies.bodyText: This method checks whether the  ipv4Addr is valid in this ip range, which means greater than or equal to firstAddr and less than or equal to lastAddr.
replies.author: chenpiaoping

replies.bodyText: Correct. I meant to use the verb "validate" as the method name to be consistent with other names.
replies.author: xieus

add ip availability to ip range
